full_summary:
# Call for Tender: Honeywell Maintenance Service Plan for Pilatus PC12 Aircraft

## Call for Tender Details

* **Solicitation Number**: 202301694
* **Trade Agreements**: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* **Region of Opportunity**: Canada
* **Region of Delivery**: Canada
* **Procurement Category**: SRVTGD (Maintenance and Repair Services)

## Tender Description

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) invites bidders to provide a Honeywell Maintenance Service Plan (MSP) for the maintenance of their fleet of 12 Pilatus PC12 aircraft. The MSP is structured on a 3-year cycle, and the RCMP is seeking a contract period of three (3) initial years, plus one (1) optional block of three (3) years for a total of six (6) years.

## Basis of Selection

Tenders will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

* **Mandatory Technical Criteria**: Airworthiness documentation
* **Point-Rated Criteria**: To be determined

## Tender Submission Requirements

* Tenders must be submitted in either English or French, and must include the following documents: 
  + A completed bid form
  + A detailed description of the proposed maintenance services
  + A price quote for the proposed services
  + Any supporting documentation as required by the solicitation

## Contact Information

For further information, please contact:

* Diane Palarchio, Procurement Specialist
* Royal Canadian Mounted Police
* 73 Leikin Dr.  Bldg M1, Ottawa, ON K1A 0R2
* Phone: (613) 404-2922
* Email: [diane.palarchio@rcmp-grc.gc.ca](mailto:diane.palarchio@rcmp-grc.gc.ca)

## Important Notes

* The RCMP has adopted the Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada. As a result, the integrity provisions are being applied in RCMP contracting activities as outlined in this solicitation.
* Canada will make available notices of proposed procurement (NPP), bid solicitations and related documents for download through the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) at [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities).
* Bidders are responsible for regularly consulting GETS for the most up-to-date information. Canada will not be liable for any oversight
